intro: Triaspis hypericoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has small, simple leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not commonly found in commercial horticulture.
